metadata.Title: CVE-2017-1000206 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
samtools htslib library version 1.4.0 and earlier is vulnerable to buffer overflow in the CRAM rANS codec resulting in potential arbitrary code execution It was discovered that HTSlib incorrectly handled certain data. An attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-1000206` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

htslib-test - 1.2.1-2ubuntu1+esm1
libhts1 - 1.2.1-2ubuntu1+esm1
tabix - 1.2.1-2ubuntu1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: htslib package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2.1-2ubuntu1+esm1').
